snippet: In the family’s wrongful death suit, e-mails from AEG Live executives were used to argue that the company neglected Michael Jackson’s health shortly before his death.
abstract: Lawyers for Michael Jackson's mother and his three children say in his wrongful death trial they believe e-mails show that AEG Live executives ignored warnings of Jackson's bad health and were negligent in hiring and supervising of Jackson's doctor, Conrad Murray.

byline.contributor: Jens Erik Gould and Rebecca Fairley Raney contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In the family’s wrongful death suit, e-mails from AEG Live executives were used to argue that the company neglected Michael Jackson’s health shortly before his death.

headline.main: Promoter Ignored Ill Singer, Jackson Family Lawyers Say
headline.print_headline: Promoter Ignored Ill Singer, Jackson Family Lawyers Say
